message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.MA, cs.GT

Reasoning: 
1. cs.IT (Information Theory): The paper proposes a joint transmission scheme for base station cooperation and analyzes the signal-to-interference ratio (SIR) distribution, which are typical topics in information theory.
2. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture): The paper focuses on cellular networks and proposes a scheme for base station cooperation, which falls under the scope of networking and internet architecture.
3. cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper proposes a tunable scheme for base station cooperation, which can be seen as a control problem in optimizing the cooperation level to improve network performance.
4. cs.MA (Multiagent Systems): The paper considers a Poisson point process (PPP) to model base station locations, which can be viewed as a multiagent system where each base station is an agent.
5. cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory): The paper studies the performance of the proposed scheme using tools from stochastic geometry, which can be related to game theory in terms of analyzing the interactions between base stations and users.
